reason.tex: \begin{align} &|A|\cdot I=A\cdot Adj(A) \\ \implies & I=A \left(\dfrac{1}{|A|}Adj(A)\right) \\ \implies & A^{-1}=\dfrac{1}{|A|}Adj(A) \end{align} \\ %text where $I$ is identity matrix. %

A=\left[\begin{array}{cc} 2 & 3 \\ 5 & -2\end{array}\right] \therefore |A|= 2\cdot(-2)-5\cdot 3=-19 \\ \begin{align} CF(A)&=\left[\begin{array}{cc} -2 & -5 \\ -3 & 2 \end{array}\right] \,\text{(cofactor matrix)}\\ Adj(A)&=CF^T \, \text{(transpose of CF)} \\ &=\left[\begin{array}{cc} -2 & -3 \\ -5 & 2 \end{array}\right] \\ A^{-1}&=-\dfrac{1}{19}\left[\begin{array}{cc} -2 & -3 \\ -5 & 2 \end{array}\right] =\dfrac{-1}{19}(-A)=\dfrac{A}{19} \end{align} \\
%text Note: In the case of a $2\times 2$ matrix, you can directly compute the inverse like so, % A=\left[\begin{array}{cc}a & b \\ c & d\end{array}\right] \implies A^{-1}=\dfrac{1}{|A|}\left[\begin{array}{cc} d & -b \\ -c & a \end{array} \right]$
